data.name: checkBox7.ToolTip
data.value: The action to take when the radio is supposed to turn on/off. Volume = Volume up/down multimedia key presses are sent repeatedly until the volume is correct. When playing music at high volumes, this can take up to a couple seconds. Toggling 'Quick Volume' will speed this process, but volume restoration is less precise. Toggling 'Ignore Modifiers' will ignore modifier keys, which will cause systemwide volume change when holding modifier keys (shift, alt, ctrl) when transitioning radio status. Enable if you have a virtual audio cable setup where system volume doesn't matter. Note: Certain programs may need to have the media keys bound manually. Mute = Mute/unmute commands are sent. No fake keypresses are sent. Play/pause = Play/pause is sent. Unlike the true GTA experience, the music is paused and resumed and will not continue playing silently in the background. Note: Pausing/Playing manually may be needed to prevent inverted radio playing.

data.name: checkBoxF.ToolTip
data.value: Select when the music should be playing. Emergency = music player will be playing when the game is playing Emergency Radio (Firetrucks, Ambulances, Police Cars) Radio = music player will be playing when the game is on a regular radio station (Both music radio & talk radio) Interiors = music player will be playing in interiors that have radio playing inside them (Does not include interiors with their own special music, such as Malibu or Caligula) Menu = music will play in pause menu (disregards whether it was playing to begin with) Kaufman = music will play in Kaufman Cab after Cabmaggedon Announcer = music will play during bridge repair/storm warning announcements on the radio
